oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Politics in country music - 2002-11-05
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Discussion on politics in country music from the Ford Theatre at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on November 5, 2002. Hosted by Chris Williams. Panelist include Rodney Crowell; Nanci Griffith; Todd Snider; Bob Titley; Clarence Spalding;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chris Williams; Rodney Crowell; Nanci Griffith; Todd Snider; Bob Titley;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes comments and questions from the audience / Recording begins in progress / (00:00) Comments about the book Red Necks and Blue Necks and introduction of panelists / (05:30) Comments about making political statements in personal appearances and the responses panelists have gotten and the vilification of the Dixie Chicks / (10:00) Nancy talks about writing songs for main stream artists / (12:28) Nanci talks about receiving feedback from a fan purchasing her product but disagreeing with her politics / (14:25) Politics being intertwined with music and Woody Guthrie / (18:05) Talk about the political environment uniqueness of the Nashville music industry / (19:27) Rodney talks about traveling to other countries and the popularity of liberal artists there / (23:15) Nanci speaks of her fear of world events and her respect for Toby Keith / (25:41) Nanci talks about her work with Vietnam veterans groups and current veterans /

(26:35) Todd talks about his song Conservative Christian, Right Wing, Republican, Straight, White, American Males and why he wrote it / (28:20) Todd's belief that Outlaw country and Garth Brooks being diametrically opposed / (29:20) Rodney comments about Garth Brooks being of the time / (30:20) Titley talks about the forming of Music Row democrats and the resistance to the approval of the groups charter in the business community and the reaction to the deregulation of the communications business / (34:41) Regional differences in politics / (36:48) Talks about the impact of the voting for someone rather than against someone and his preference of John McCain over Hillary Clinton / (39:10) Questions from the audience / (40:10) Titley talks about the impact of broadcast media, the passive audience and what the future of social media may hold / (43:45) Titley talks about the perceptions of the core audience in radio for country music /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Williams, Chris; Crowell, Rodney; Griffith, Nanci; Snider, Todd; Titley, Bob; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
